meta-model.name: Baseball ToE Meta Model
meta-model.description: A unified meta-model capturing the entire domain of baseball—teams, players, games, innings, stats, and rules—within a purely declarative structure. All domain logic—like scoring, outs, pitch outcomes, lineups, or statistics—are expressed using lookups, aggregations, constraints, and event-based facts—no imperative instructions.

meta.title: Baseball ToE Meta-Model
meta.subtitle: A 100% Declarative Framework for the Sport's Structures and Rules
meta.abstract: The Baseball extension of the CMCC (Conceptual Model Completeness Conjecture) systematically represents baseball’s core objects—Teams, Players, Games, Innings, At-Bats—under a single Snapshot-Consistent schema. We’ve rewritten the entire specification to be 100% declarative, replacing stepwise imperative logic with event-based or aggregator-based facts. Everything from run scoring, outs, pitch results, and roster assignments is specified as constraints, lookups, aggregator fields, or derived booleans—ensuring that the model is purely descriptive. No domain logic is expressed as do-this-then-do-that instructions.

key_points: Models baseball’s entire rule structure—teams, rosters, innings, batting orders, stats—declaratively with aggregator formulas, event-based facts, and constraints.
Eliminates the need for any imperative code blocks or specialized DSL instructions.
Demonstrates flexibility for advanced sabermetrics, tying directly into this purely factual data structure.
Seamlessly integrates with other CMCC domains (e.g., economics or sociology) for cross-domain synergy.
implications: Provides a universal environment for capturing baseball rules in a purely fact-based manner.
Greatly simplifies or eliminates stateful code, since all logic is derived from the presence/absence of events or stated data.
Supports advanced analytics—once in the data, aggregator fields can unify everything from pitch-level detail to multi-season advanced metrics.

narrative.title: Purely Declarative Baseball Extension
content: In this version, we removed all imperative instructions (e.g., 'increment outs', 'set status') and replaced them with aggregator fields or constraints referencing new event entities or pre-existing relationships. For instance, an InningHalf’s outs are now simply the count of 'OutEvent' records referencing that half-inning. A game is 'in progress' if certain conditions in the data hold (status='IN_PROGRESS' AND we haven't reached final conditions). No procedure calls are needed to change states; the data itself drives the logic. This architecture helps ensure the system remains consistent and transparent: any change to the data is automatically reflected in the aggregator fields, with no hidden or procedural steps to update them.

entities.name: League
entities.description: Represents an organized group of baseball teams playing under the same rule set. Could be MLB, minor leagues, or an amateur league.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the league.

fields.name: leagueName
fields.description: The official or common name of the league.

lookups.name: teams
lookups.description: Collection of Teams belonging to this league.

aggregations.name: teamCount
aggregations.description: Number of teams in this league.

aggregations.name: totalGamesPlayed
aggregations.description: Sum of all Games completed by all Teams in the league. Implementation conceptual, scanning each team's 'gamesPlayed'.

aggregations.name: bestTeam
aggregations.description: The team with the highest win percentage in this league (declarative aggregator).

aggregations.name: worstTeam
aggregations.description: The team with the lowest win percentage in this league (declarative aggregator).

aggregations.name: averageTeamERA
aggregations.description: The average ERA across all teams in this league. Implementation conceptual, could sum or average pitchers’ ERA or overall team ERA.

aggregations.name: totalLeagueHomeRuns
aggregations.description: The sum of all home runs hit by players on all teams in this league, purely data-based aggregator.

aggregations.name: totalLeagueStolenBases
aggregations.description: The sum of all stolen bases by players on all teams in this league.

aggregations.name: leagueOPSLeaders
aggregations.description: Top 3 players in the league by OPS. Implementation conceptual using all rosters in this league.

aggregations.name: leagueMinERA
aggregations.description: Identifies the single pitcher in the league with the lowest ERA. Implementation conceptual—filters for pitchers only.

aggregations.name: mostCommonBattingHand
aggregations.description: Identifies the batting hand (L, R, or S) that is most common among all players in the league's teams.

aggregations.name: leagueWalkToStrikeoutRatio
aggregations.description: Computes total walks / total strikeouts across all players in the league. Conceptual aggregator.

lambdas.name: scheduleMatchups
lambdas.description: // CHANGED (DECLARATIVE): Instead of 'create' schedules, we declare that a 'ScheduledMatchup' entity must exist for each pair of teams. Implementation conceptual.

entities.name: Team
entities.description: A baseball team. Belongs to one League, has a roster of Players, and competes in Games.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the team.

fields.name: teamName
fields.description: Name or nickname of the team.

fields.name: league_id
fields.description: Indicates which League this team belongs to.

lookups.name: roster
lookups.description: All players currently on the team.

aggregations.name: rosterSize
aggregations.description: Number of players on the team's active roster.

aggregations.name: gamesPlayed
aggregations.description: Number of Games in which this team has participated (data-based aggregator).

aggregations.name: wins
aggregations.description: Count of Games this team has won (pure aggregator, no imperative updates).

aggregations.name: losses
aggregations.description: Count of Games this team has lost.

aggregations.name: winPercentage
aggregations.description: wins / (wins + losses), if any games played. Null otherwise.

aggregations.name: averageTeamBattingAverage
aggregations.description: The average batting average among all players on the roster, purely aggregator.

aggregations.name: totalTeamRuns
aggregations.description: Total runs scored by this team (across all games). Implementation conceptual.

aggregations.name: totalTeamHomeRuns
aggregations.description: Sum of home runs hit by all players on this team.

aggregations.name: totalTeamStolenBases
aggregations.description: Sum of stolen bases by all players on this team.

aggregations.name: averageFieldingPercentage
aggregations.description: The team’s overall fielding percentage, averaging all players’ fielding percentages who actively field.

aggregations.name: winningPercentageInStadium
aggregations.description: Team’s historical winning percentage in a given stadium—pure aggregator referencing stadium-based game data.

aggregations.name: bestPitcher
aggregations.description: Finds the pitcher on this team with the lowest ERA (pure aggregator).

aggregations.name: totalWalks
aggregations.description: Sums all walks drawn by players on this team.

aggregations.name: totalHitByPitch
aggregations.description: Sums all HBP events for players on this team.

aggregations.name: teamSluggingPct
aggregations.description: Overall slugging percentage for the team, computed by summing total bases across all players and dividing by total at-bats.

aggregations.name: homeRunsPerGame
aggregations.description: Team’s home runs divided by the total games played, if gamesPlayed>0.

aggregations.name: pitcherCount
aggregations.description: Number of players on the roster who are pitchers (or have pitched). Implementation conceptual if 'playerIsPitcher' is known.

aggregations.name: shutoutsAchieved
aggregations.description: Count how many shutout wins this team has recorded. Conceptual aggregator scanning final games where runsAllowed=0.
aggregations.formula: COUNT(Game WHERE winnerId=this.id AND (IF homeTeamId=this.id THEN runsAway=0 ELSE runsHome=0))

aggregations.name: currentWinStreak
aggregations.description: How many consecutive games (starting with the most recent) the team has won. Implementation conceptual, purely aggregator-based.

aggregations.name: pythagWinPct
aggregations.description: Estimates winning percentage from runs scored vs. runs allowed (Pythagorean expectation).
aggregations.formula: IF(totalTeamRuns>0 OR runsAllowed>0) THEN (POWER(totalTeamRuns,2)/(POWER(totalTeamRuns,2)+POWER(runsAllowed,2))) ELSE null

aggregations.name: teamWalkRate
aggregations.description: Walks drawn per plate appearance by the entire team.

aggregations.name: teamStrikeoutRate
aggregations.description: Team-wide ratio of strikeouts to total plate appearances.

aggregations.name: runsAllowed
aggregations.description: Total runs allowed by this team across all games (aggregator from the defensive perspective).

lambdas.name: addPlayerToRoster
lambdas.description: // CHANGED (DECLARATIVE): Instead of 'Set Player.team_id = ...', we state a constraint/fact: 'Player.team_id' should match 'this.id'.

lambdas.name: removePlayerFromRoster
lambdas.description: // CHANGED (DECLARATIVE): In a purely declarative sense, removing means 'player.team_id = null' is a valid state. No imperative steps.

entities.name: Player
entities.description: An individual who participates in baseball games, either as a position player, pitcher, or both.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the player.

fields.name: fullName
fields.description: Player's full name.

fields.name: battingHand
fields.description: Indicates 'L', 'R', or 'S' (switch).

fields.name: throwingHand
fields.description: Indicates 'L' or 'R'.

fields.name: team_id
fields.description: Which Team this player is currently on, if any.

lookups.name: defensivePositions
lookups.description: All possible defensive positions the player can handle. Implementation: PlayerPosition join table or similar.

aggregations.name: careerAtBats
aggregations.description: How many official at-bats the player has had across all games.

aggregations.name: careerHits
aggregations.description: How many hits the player has recorded across all at-bats.
aggregations.formula: COUNT( AtBat where (batterId=this.id AND result in ['SINGLE','DOUBLE','TRIPLE','HOMERUN']) )

aggregations.name: careerBattingAverage
aggregations.description: (careerHits / careerAtBats). Null if no at-bats.

aggregations.name: careerPitchCount
aggregations.description: Total number of pitches thrown by this player, if a pitcher.

aggregations.name: careerStrikeoutsPitched
aggregations.description: How many strikeouts the player (as pitcher) has recorded.

aggregations.name: careerInningsPitched
aggregations.description: Summation of partial innings if the player is a pitcher. Implementation conceptual.

aggregations.name: onBasePercentage
aggregations.description: OBP = (H + BB + HBP) / (AB + BB + HBP + SF). Implementation conceptual if advanced data is tracked.
aggregations.formula: IF (plateAppearances>0) THEN ((careerHits + careerWalks + careerHitByPitch) / (careerAtBats + careerWalks + careerHitByPitch + careerSacFlies)) ELSE null

aggregations.name: sluggingPercentage
aggregations.description: Total bases / at-bats. Implementation conceptual if we track 2B,3B,HR, etc.

aggregations.name: ops
aggregations.description: On-base plus slugging, purely aggregator of the OBP + SLG fields.

aggregations.name: stolenBasePercentage
aggregations.description: stolenBases / (stolenBases + caughtStealing). Implementation conceptual if we track that data.
aggregations.formula: IF ((careerStolenBases + careerCaughtStealing) > 0) THEN (careerStolenBases / (careerStolenBases + careerCaughtStealing)) ELSE null

aggregations.name: isTwoWayPlayer
aggregations.description: Boolean indicating if the player has pitched and also batted as a regular hitter. Implementation conceptual.
aggregations.formula: IF (careerInningsPitched > 0 AND careerAtBats > 0) THEN true ELSE false

aggregations.name: careerWalks
aggregations.description: Count of times the player reached base via walk (BB).
aggregations.formula: COUNT( AtBat where batterId=this.id AND result='WALK' )

aggregations.name: careerHitByPitch
aggregations.description: Count of times the player was hit by a pitch (HBP).
aggregations.formula: COUNT( AtBat where batterId=this.id AND result='HIT_BY_PITCH' )

aggregations.name: careerSacFlies
aggregations.description: Count of official at-bats with a sac fly result.
aggregations.formula: COUNT( AtBat where batterId=this.id AND result='SAC_FLY')

aggregations.name: careerDoublePlaysGroundedInto
aggregations.description: Number of times the player has grounded into a double play.
aggregations.formula: COUNT( AtBat where batterId=this.id AND result='GROUNDED_INTO_DOUBLE_PLAY')

aggregations.name: highestExitVelocity
aggregations.description: Max exit velocity recorded for batted balls by this player (across all relevant at-bats).

aggregations.name: lowestExitVelocity
aggregations.description: Min exit velocity recorded for batted balls by this player.

aggregations.name: careerSluggingPct
aggregations.description: Slugging percentage across all at-bats in the player's career (total bases / careerAtBats). Implementation conceptual.

aggregations.name: careerOPS
aggregations.description: Career On-base plus slugging for this player: onBasePercentage + careerSluggingPct.

aggregations.name: hitsAbove100ExitVelo
aggregations.description: Number of hits where the exit velocity exceeded 100 mph.
aggregations.formula: COUNT( AtBat where batterId=this.id AND exitVelocity>100 AND result in ['SINGLE','DOUBLE','TRIPLE','HOMERUN'])

aggregations.name: outsRecordedAsPitcher
aggregations.description: How many outs this player has generated in a pitching role. Implementation conceptual—count OutEvents where pitcherId=this.id.
aggregations.formula: COUNT( OutEvent where (atBatId!=null AND AtBat.pitcherId=this.id) OR (someOtherPitcherOutRef) )

aggregations.name: totalBases
aggregations.description: Sum of bases the player has earned via hits (1 for single, 2 for double, etc.). Implementation conceptual scanning all hits.

aggregations.name: hasCycleInAnyGame
aggregations.description: Indicates whether the player has ever completed a single, double, triple, and home run in the same game.
aggregations.formula: EXISTS(Game WHERE EXISTS(AtBat[batterId=this.id AND gameId=Game.id AND result='SINGLE']) AND EXISTS(AtBat[batterId=this.id AND gameId=Game.id AND result='DOUBLE']) AND EXISTS(AtBat[batterId=this.id AND gameId=Game.id AND result='TRIPLE']) AND EXISTS(AtBat[batterId=this.id AND gameId=Game.id AND result='HOMERUN']))

aggregations.name: longestHitStreak
aggregations.description: The maximum consecutive-game hitting streak in the player's career.

aggregations.name: longestOnBaseStreak
aggregations.description: The maximum consecutive-game streak where the player reached base at least once (hit, walk, HBP, etc.).

aggregations.name: careerIso
aggregations.description: Isolated Power = slugging percentage - batting average.
aggregations.formula: IF(careerSluggingPct!=null AND careerBattingAverage!=null) THEN (careerSluggingPct - careerBattingAverage) ELSE null

aggregations.name: careerDoublePlaysTurned
aggregations.description: How many double plays the player has been credited with turning on defense.

aggregations.name: careerTriplePlaysTurned
aggregations.description: How many triple plays the player has been credited with turning on defense.

aggregations.name: careerMaxHomeRunDistance
aggregations.description: Maximum recorded distance of any home run for this player.
aggregations.formula: MAX(AtBat WHERE batterId=this.id AND result='HOMERUN' => battedBallDistance)

aggregations.name: careerGrandSlams
aggregations.description: Number of home runs with the bases loaded (4 RBI).
aggregations.formula: COUNT(AtBat WHERE batterId=this.id AND result='HOMERUN' AND baseStateBeforePitch='BASES_LOADED')

aggregations.name: careerWalkOffHits
aggregations.description: Count of game-ending hits delivered by the player (walk-off singles, doubles, etc.).
aggregations.formula: COUNT(AtBat WHERE batterId=this.id AND result IN ['SINGLE','DOUBLE','TRIPLE','HOMERUN'] AND AtBatEndsGame=true)

aggregations.name: careerWOBA
aggregations.description: Weighted On-Base Average, using established wOBA coefficients.

aggregations.name: careerWRCPlus
aggregations.description: Weighted Runs Created Plus, comparing player to league average = 100.

aggregations.name: careerDefensiveErrors
aggregations.description: Number of times the player committed an error (tracked via ErrorEvent).

aggregations.name: careerPlateAppearances
aggregations.description: Comprehensive aggregator for all times the player came to bat, including walks, HBP, sacrifices, etc.

aggregations.name: careerDefensiveChances
aggregations.description: Sum of outs plus errors for which this player was the fielder (defensive opportunities).

aggregations.name: careerFieldingPercentage
aggregations.description: Fielding percentage = (chances - errors) / chances, if chances > 0.

aggregations.name: careerSacBunts
aggregations.description: Number of successful sacrifice bunts for the player.

lambdas.name: adjustBattingHand
lambdas.description: // CHANGED (DECLARATIVE): Instead of imperative 'Set battingHand=newHand', we declare a constraint that the player's battingHand must match 'newHand'.

entities.name: DefensivePosition
entities.description: A position on the baseball field, e.g. pitcher (1), catcher (2), shortstop (6), etc.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique ID for the position (often '1','2','3','4','5','6','7','8','9' or 'DH').

fields.name: positionName
fields.description: Descriptive name (Pitcher, Catcher, Shortstop, etc.).

entities.name: Game
entities.description: Represents a single baseball game between two Teams, split into innings (top & bottom).

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the game.

fields.name: homeTeamId
fields.description: Which team is playing at home.

fields.name: awayTeamId
fields.description: Which team is visiting.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Game status: e.g. 'SCHEDULED','IN_PROGRESS','FINAL'.

lookups.name: innings
lookups.description: All Inning records associated with this Game.

aggregations.name: currentInningNumber
aggregations.description: Highest inningNumber in innings that have started or are in progress.
aggregations.formula: IF innings != null THEN MAX(innings.inningNumber) ELSE null

aggregations.name: runsHome
aggregations.description: Total runs scored by the home team, summing relevant half-innings for the home offense.
aggregations.formula: SUM( InningHalf.runsScored for all bottomHalves with offensiveTeamId=homeTeamId )

aggregations.name: runsAway
aggregations.description: Total runs scored by the away team, summing relevant half-innings for the away offense.
aggregations.formula: SUM( InningHalf.runsScored for all topHalves with offensiveTeamId=awayTeamId )

aggregations.name: winnerId
aggregations.description: If status='FINAL', whichever team has more runs. Null if tie or incomplete.
aggregations.formula: IF (status='FINAL') THEN (IF runsHome>runsAway THEN homeTeamId ELSE IF runsAway>runsHome THEN awayTeamId ELSE null) ELSE null

aggregations.name: loserId
aggregations.description: Symmetric aggregator to winnerId; identifies losing team if final and not tied.
aggregations.formula: IF status='FINAL' AND runsHome!=runsAway THEN (IF winnerId=homeTeamId THEN awayTeamId ELSE homeTeamId) ELSE null

aggregations.name: totalPitchesInGame
aggregations.description: Total number of pitches thrown in this game (pure aggregator across all at-bats).

aggregations.name: hasWalkOffOpportunity
aggregations.description: True if it's bottom of 9th+ with the home team trailing/tied so a scoring play could end the game. Implementation conceptual, purely declarative.

aggregations.name: attendance
aggregations.description: Reference or aggregator for game attendance, e.g., from an external record or data field.

aggregations.name: isExtraInnings
aggregations.description: Boolean indicating if the game went beyond the 9th inning.

aggregations.name: largestLead
aggregations.description: Maximum difference in runs between the two teams at any point in this game.

aggregations.name: isShutout
aggregations.description: True if one team finishes with 0 runs (and the game is FINAL).
aggregations.formula: IF (status='FINAL') THEN ((runsHome==0 AND runsAway>0) OR (runsAway==0 AND runsHome>0)) ELSE false

aggregations.name: shutoutTeamId
aggregations.description: If the game is a shutout, indicates which team allowed 0 runs. Null if no shutout or tie at 0-0.
aggregations.formula: IF (isShutout=true) THEN (IF runsHome==0 THEN awayTeamId ELSE IF runsAway==0 THEN homeTeamId ELSE null) ELSE null

aggregations.name: totalWalksInGame
aggregations.description: Count of all at-bats with 'result=WALK' in both halves across all innings for this game.

aggregations.name: leadChanges
aggregations.description: How many times the lead switched from one team to another during this game.

aggregations.name: tieCount
aggregations.description: How many times the score returned to a tie after first pitch.

lambdas.name: startGame
lambdas.description: // CHANGED (DECLARATIVE): Instead of setting 'status=IN_PROGRESS', we define a constraint: if the game has begun, status must be 'IN_PROGRESS'.
lambdas.formula: IF (EXISTS(any pitch or any top inning started)) THEN (this.status == 'IN_PROGRESS')

lambdas.name: endGame
lambdas.description: // CHANGED (DECLARATIVE): Instead of setting 'status=FINAL', we define conditions for final. If 9+ innings done, runs differ, status must be 'FINAL'.

constraints.name: teamMismatch
constraints.error_message: Home and away team cannot be the same.

entities.name: Inning
entities.description: A single inning in the game, typically has a top and bottom half unless extras are needed.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique ID for this inning record.

fields.name: gameId
fields.description: Which game this inning belongs to.

fields.name: inningNumber
fields.description: Which inning number (1..9, or extras).

lookups.name: top
lookups.description: The top half of this inning, if defined.

lookups.name: bottom
lookups.description: The bottom half of this inning, if defined.

aggregations.name: isComplete
aggregations.description: True if top and bottom half are both complete, or if there's a walk-off scenario that ends the inning early.

aggregations.name: runsThisInning
aggregations.description: Sum of runs in top and bottom half of this inning.
aggregations.formula: (IF top!=null THEN top.runsScored ELSE 0) + (IF bottom!=null THEN bottom.runsScored ELSE 0)

aggregations.name: averageExitVelocityInInning
aggregations.description: Mean exit velocity of all batted balls (AtBat.exitVelocity) in top+bottom halves of this inning.

aggregations.name: totalWalksInInning
aggregations.description: Count of at-bats with 'result=WALK' in the top and bottom half of this inning combined.

entities.name: InningHalf
entities.description: Represents either top or bottom portion of an inning, with outs, runs, at-bats, etc. All purely event/aggregator based.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique ID for this half-inning record.

fields.name: halfType
fields.description: TOP or BOTTOM.

fields.name: offensiveTeamId
fields.description: Which team is batting.

fields.name: defensiveTeamId
fields.description: Which team is in the field.

fields.name: outs
fields.description: Number of outs recorded so far. // CHANGED (DECLARATIVE) We keep this as a 'field' but treat it as an aggregator from OutEvents.

fields.name: runsScored
fields.description: Tally of runs in this half-inning. // CHANGED (DECLARATIVE) Treated as aggregator from RunEvents or from sum of AtBat.rbi.

fields.name: isComplete
fields.description: True if 3 outs are reached or walk-off ends this half. // CHANGED (DECLARATIVE) We interpret as aggregator or constraint.

lookups.name: atBats
lookups.description: All plate appearances in this half-inning.

aggregations.name: battersFaced
aggregations.description: Number of batters who came up to the plate (size of atBats).

aggregations.name: hitsInHalf
aggregations.description: How many hits (1B,2B,3B,HR) occurred in this half.
aggregations.formula: COUNT( AtBat where (inningHalfId=this.id AND result in ['SINGLE','DOUBLE','TRIPLE','HOMERUN']) )

aggregations.name: leftOnBase
aggregations.description: How many baserunners remained stranded when the half-inning ended. Implementation conceptual, purely aggregator over base-runner state.

aggregations.name: walksInHalf
aggregations.description: Count of at-bats with 'result= WALK' in this half-inning.

aggregations.name: hitByPitchInHalf
aggregations.description: Count of at-bats with 'result=HIT_BY_PITCH' in this half-inning.

aggregations.name: mostPitchesFacedBySingleBatter
aggregations.description: The maximum pitch count in any single AtBat within this half-inning.

aggregations.name: hitsWithExitVelocityAbove90
aggregations.description: Number of hits in this half-inning that had exitVelocity > 90 mph.
aggregations.formula: COUNT(AtBat where inningHalfId=this.id AND exitVelocity>90 AND result in ['SINGLE','DOUBLE','TRIPLE','HOMERUN'])

lambdas.name: recordOut
lambdas.description: // CHANGED (DECLARATIVE): Instead of incrementing outs, we define an 'OutEvent' entity. 'outs' aggregator = COUNT(OutEvent).

lambdas.name: scoreRun
lambdas.description: // CHANGED (DECLARATIVE): Instead of incrementing runs, a 'RunEvent' entity or sum of AtBat.rbi. 'runsScored' aggregator = SUM(RunEvent.runs).

constraints.name: validOutCount
constraints.error_message: Outs must be between 0 and 3 inclusive.

constraints.name: isCompleteWhen3OutsOrWalkoff
constraints.error_message: Half-inning completes with 3 outs or a declared walk-off event.

entities.name: AtBat
entities.description: A single plate appearance, from the start of the batter's turn to its final result. All logic is aggregator-based, no step-by-step updates.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique ID for this at-bat record.

fields.name: inningHalfId
fields.description: Which half-inning this at-bat belongs to.

fields.name: batterId
fields.description: Player who is batting.

fields.name: pitcherId
fields.description: Player (pitcher) on defense facing the batter.

fields.name: result
fields.description: Outcome: e.g. 'SINGLE','DOUBLE','TRIPLE','HOMERUN','WALK','STRIKEOUT','GROUNDOUT','FLYOUT','HIT_BY_PITCH','SAC_FLY','GROUNDED_INTO_DOUBLE_PLAY', etc.

fields.name: rbi
fields.description: Number of runs batted in on this at-bat (0..4).

fields.name: exitVelocity
fields.description: Measured speed of the batted ball off the bat (mph), if the ball was put in play. Null if not in play.

fields.name: launchAngle
fields.description: Angle (in degrees) of the batted ball’s trajectory, if in play.

lookups.name: pitches
lookups.description: All Pitch records thrown in this at-bat.

aggregations.name: pitchCountInAtBat
aggregations.description: Number of pitches thrown in this at-bat.

aggregations.name: fouls
aggregations.description: Number of foul pitches among 'pitches'.

aggregations.name: expectedBattingAverage
aggregations.description: A sabermetric measure (xBA) based on exit velocity, launch angle, etc. Implementation conceptual, purely aggregator.

aggregations.name: wasWalk
aggregations.description: Boolean aggregator: true if result='WALK'.

aggregations.name: plateDisciplineIndex
aggregations.description: Conceptual measure of a batter's plate discipline for this at-bat, e.g. proportion of 'chases' outside the zone vs. total pitches.

aggregations.name: numberOfBalls
aggregations.description: Count of pitches in this at-bat where pitchResult='BALL'.
aggregations.formula: COUNT( Pitch where atBatId=this.id AND pitchResult='BALL')

lambdas.name: addPitch
lambdas.description: // CHANGED (DECLARATIVE): Instead of 'INSERT' pitch, we declare that all pitch entities referencing this atBatId belong to 'pitches'.

lambdas.name: finalizeAtBat
lambdas.description: // CHANGED (DECLARATIVE): No step to 'lock in' result. We have a constraint: AtBat is complete if 'result' is one of the final states. No imperative update needed.

entities.name: Pitch
entities.description: Represents a single pitch thrown in an at-bat. Tracks velocity, location, outcome, etc., with no imperative instructions.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique ID for this pitch record.

fields.name: atBatId
fields.description: Which at-bat this pitch belongs to.

fields.name: pitchResult
fields.description: One of 'BALL','CALLED_STRIKE','SWINGING_STRIKE','FOUL','IN_PLAY','HIT_BY_PITCH', etc.

fields.name: pitchVelocity
fields.description: Speed of the pitch, typically in mph or km/h.

fields.name: pitchSpinRate
fields.description: Spin rate of the pitch in revolutions per minute (rpm).

aggregations.name: isStrike
aggregations.description: Boolean aggregator: true if pitchResult is CALLED_STRIKE or SWINGING_STRIKE.

aggregations.name: isQualityPitch
aggregations.description: True if pitchVelocity > 95 and pitchSpinRate > 2200, purely an example threshold-based aggregator.

aggregations.name: adjustedSpinRate
aggregations.description: Derived spin rate that might account for velocity or environmental factors. Implementation conceptual.

entities.name: Statistic
entities.description: Generic or specialized statistical measures referencing a Player, Team, or entire league. Could store advanced sabermetrics or simpler metrics.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique ID for this stat record.

fields.name: entityType
fields.description: Indicates whether this stat applies to 'Player','Team','League'.

fields.name: entityId
fields.description: ID of the specific entity (player/team/league) to which the stat belongs. Implementation conceptual.

fields.name: statName
fields.description: E.g. 'OPS','ERA','WAR','fieldingPercentage'.

fields.name: statValue
fields.description: Numeric result of the stat calculation.

fields.name: season
fields.description: Optional label for which season or time period this stat references.

fields.name: lastUpdated
fields.description: Timestamp indicating when this stat was last updated.

entities.name: Stadium
entities.description: Represents a ballpark or stadium where games are played. Purely declarative references to capacity, location, etc.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique ID for this stadium.

fields.name: stadiumName
fields.description: The official or common name of the stadium.

fields.name: capacity
fields.description: Maximum seating capacity of the stadium.

aggregations.name: gamesPlayedInStadium
aggregations.description: Number of games that have taken place in this stadium. Implementation conceptual, would require a link from Game to Stadium.

aggregations.name: averageAttendance
aggregations.description: Average attendance across all games played here. Implementation conceptual.

aggregations.name: mostRunsInSingleGame
aggregations.description: Maximum total runs (home + away) for any game played in this stadium.

aggregations.name: averageHRPerGame
aggregations.description: Average number of home runs per game in this stadium. Implementation conceptual if we track HR data by stadium.

aggregations.name: daysSinceLastGame
aggregations.description: Time (in days) since the most recent game played here. Implementation conceptual—compares current date to the MAX(gameDate).

entities.name: OutEvent
entities.description: // NEW: Fact-based approach for recording outs. Each OutEvent references which half-inning or at-bat triggered the out. Eliminates imperative increments.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique out event record.

fields.name: inningHalfId
fields.description: Which half-inning this out belongs to.

fields.name: atBatId
fields.description: Optional reference to which at-bat caused the out. Could be null if it's a pickoff or baserunning out.

fields_additional.name: outType
fields_additional.description: Describes how the out occurred (flyout, groundout, strikeout, etc.).

entities.name: RunEvent
entities.description: // NEW: Fact-based approach for runs. Each RunEvent references which half-inning or at-bat triggered a run, ensuring no imperative 'scoreRun()'.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique run event record.

fields.name: inningHalfId
fields.description: Which half-inning this run belongs to.

fields.name: atBatId
fields.description: Optional reference to the at-bat that batted in the run. Could be null if it’s a wild pitch, error, etc.

fields.name: runCount
fields.description: How many runs scored on this event (often 1, but could be more if multiple runners score simultaneously).

fields_additional.name: runScorerIds
fields_additional.description: List or array of the player IDs who actually crossed home plate in this run event. Implementation conceptual.

entities.name: Season
entities.description: // NEW ENTITY: Represents a baseball season, with a start/end date, name, etc.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for the season.

fields.name: seasonName
fields.description: Label for the season (e.g. '2025 MLB Season').

fields.name: startDate
fields.description: Official start date of this season.

fields.name: endDate
fields.description: Official end date of this season.

aggregations.name: gamesInSeason
aggregations.description: Counts how many games are in this season (pure aggregator).

entities.name: SeasonTeamStats
entities.description: // NEW ENTITY: Ties a Team to a particular Season, storing aggregated seasonal stats, e.g. winning streaks, etc.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique identifier for this SeasonTeamStats record.

fields.name: seasonId
fields.description: Which season this record belongs to.

fields.name: teamId
fields.description: Which team is being tracked.

aggregations.name: teamWinningStreak
aggregations.description: Longest consecutive wins streak for the team during this season. Implementation conceptual.

aggregations.name: runDifferential
aggregations.description: Runs scored minus runs allowed by a team in a given season.
aggregations.formula: (SUM(Game[seasonId=this.seasonId AND (homeTeamId=this.teamId OR awayTeamId=this.teamId) => runsScoredByTeam]) - SUM(Game[seasonId=this.seasonId AND (homeTeamId=this.teamId OR awayTeamId=this.teamId) => runsAllowedByTeam]))

root-meta-model.title: The Conceptual Model Completeness Conjecture (CMCC)
root-meta-model.subtitle: A Universal Declarative Computational Framework
root-meta-model.abstract: The Conceptual Model Completeness Conjecture (CMCC) posits that the declarative semantics of any conceptual model can be captured using five fundamental primitives—Schema (S), Data (D), Lookups (L), Aggregations (A), and Lambda Calculated Fields (F)—within a Snapshot-Consistent environment. This updated baseball model exemplifies how all domain logic can be expressed purely as constraints, aggregator fields, or relationships, removing all imperative steps.

key_points: Demonstrates how to remove imperative step-by-step logic and convert it to data-driven or aggregator-driven facts.
Proves the feasibility of purely declarative baseball rules, from runs to outs to final game states.
Illustrates how new entities like OutEvent and RunEvent can remove the need for explicit 'recordOut()' or 'scoreRun()' calls.
implications: Potential unification of domain modeling under a purely fact-based approach, cutting out mutable, stepwise logic.
Data changes automatically reflect in aggregator fields, ensuring consistency at all times with no update commands.
Enables advanced simulation, analytics, or knowledge-graph queries in any environment supporting declarative rule evaluation.

sections.title: Executive Summary
content: The pivot from partial-imperative to purely declarative removes the last bits of 'if-then-do-something' logic. All game states—outs, runs, or game completion—are determined by the presence of event records and aggregator formulas. We introduced entities like OutEvent and RunEvent for outs and runs, so that at any time, the system can see 'outs=3' or 'runs>opponentRuns' and derive that an inning/game is finished. No imperative instruction is needed to 'increment' or 'set' these values; they follow naturally from the underlying event data.

This approach underscores the power of the CMCC framework (S, D, L, A, F). The domain structure is expressed via the schema (S), actual values or events appear in the data (D), references or relationships are lookups (L), aggregator fields (A) compute rollups or derived states, and lambda fields (F) can define purely functional or constraint-based logic. The entire baseball domain logic emerges from these relationships—no custom code is required to orchestrate state transitions.

CMCC_ToEMM_Domain_List.name: Baseball ToE Meta-Model
CMCC_ToEMM_Domain_List.description: A structured model capturing the domain of baseball, including leagues, teams, players, games, innings, at-bats, and stats, in a 100% declarative style.

CMCC_ToEMM_Domain_List.name: Mathematics ToE Meta-Model
CMCC_ToEMM_Domain_List.description: A structured model covering foundational mathematics, including sets, functions, proofs, structures, and category theory.

CMCC_ToEMM_Domain_List.name: Physics ToE Meta-Model
CMCC_ToEMM_Domain_List.description: A unified model for physics, including classical mechanics, quantum mechanics, gauge fields, wavefunctions, relativity, and black hole dynamics.

CMCC_ToEMM_Domain_List.name: Chemistry ToE Meta-Model
CMCC_ToEMM_Domain_List.description: Extends the Physics TOE with atomic structures, molecular interactions, bonds, and chemical reactions.

CMCC_ToEMM_Domain_List.name: Biology ToE Meta-Model
CMCC_ToEMM_Domain_List.description: Bridges Chemistry and Physics TOEs to model biological systems, including genes, proteins, metabolism, and cellular structures.

CMCC_ToEMM_Domain_List.name: Artificial Intelligence ToE Meta-Model
CMCC_ToEMM_Domain_List.description: Encapsulates machine learning, neural networks, training datasets, reinforcement learning, and inference mechanisms.

CMCC_ToEMM_Domain_List.name: Economics ToE Meta-Model
CMCC_ToEMM_Domain_List.description: A computational model for economic agents, markets, transactions, and supply-demand constraints.

CMCC_ToEMM_Domain_List.name: Astronomy ToE Meta-Model
CMCC_ToEMM_Domain_List.description: An extension of the Physics TOE to model celestial bodies, star systems, orbital dynamics, and large-scale cosmic structures.

CMCC_ToEMM_Domain_List.name: Geology
CMCC_ToEMM_Domain_List.description: A model integrating physics and chemistry to represent minerals, rock formations, and tectonic processes.

CMCC_ToEMM_Domain_List.name: Medicine & Healthcare ToE Meta-Model
CMCC_ToEMM_Domain_List.description: A unified model capturing foundational aspects of medicine and healthcare, including patient records, clinical trial data, treatment plans, and analytics.

CMCC_ToEMM_Domain_List.name: Legal Systems & Compliance ToE Meta-Model
CMCC_ToEMM_Domain_List.description: A unified model for legal systems, contracts, statutory frameworks, and regulatory compliance.

CMCC_ToEMM_Domain_List.fullname: Climate Science and Environmental Modeling ToE Meta-Model
CMCC_ToEMM_Domain_List.name: Climate Science ToE Meta-Model
CMCC_ToEMM_Domain_List.description: A unified model for climate science and environmental modeling, capturing climate variables, ecosystems, pollution sources, and environmental data.

CMCC_ToEMM_Domain_List.name: Cybersecurity ToE Meta-Model
CMCC_ToEMM_Domain_List.description: A unified model for cybersecurity covering threat models, vulnerabilities, IT asset mappings, incident logs, and security audits.

CMCC_ToEMM_Domain_List.name: Sociology & Anthropology ToE Meta-Model
CMCC_ToEMM_Domain_List.description: A structured model capturing social structures, cultural norms, and interaction networks using survey data, demographic records, and social network relationships.
